entry.title: TDCC joins Canadian Org as Co-investigator in a Project Funded by Grand Challenges Canada
entry.content:
TDCC becomes Co-investigator in Grand Challenges Canada Star of Global Health Award for the project “Development of Low Cost Diagnostic and Monitoring Method for Diabetes Prevention”. Further information on the project is available at:

Description (text, Google Docs)


Quick video description (2 min, Youtube)

Grand Challenges Canada is funded by the Government of Canada and is dedicated to supporting Bold Ideas with Big Impact in global health.

entry.title: Invited by US-India Science and Technology Forum
entry.content: TDCC invited by The US-India Science and Technology Forum to present Low Cost Diagnostic Approach for Diabetes Prevention at IIM-Ahmedabad.

entry.title: Initiates Workshop for Students
entry.content: TDCC initiates workshops for students and others who are interested to join the industry or start own enterprises. Workshops for the following fields are being held: Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics & Communications, Electronics & Telecommunications, Software, Biotechnology engineering, Social Sciences, Applied Sciences, Management, Business and Entrepreneurship. Please see the ‘Workshop’ section under ‘Employment’.

entry.title: Shortlisted by US-India Science & Technology Forum
entry.content: TDCC shortlisted by United States – India Science and Technology Forum for Development of Low Cost Diagnostic Method for Diabetes Prevention. The method under development in collaboration with Prevendia Inc., California is expected to impact an estimated 68 million non-diabetic non-obese undiagnosed insulin resistant population and 40 million obese insulin resistant population in the US; and an estimated 70-100 million population in India, 50% of whom live in rural areas and 30% in urban areas.

entry.title: Delivery of Improved and Enhanced Version of Biomedical Research Equipment
entry.content: TDCC delivers improved and enhanced equipment developed for biomedical research to Toronto Rehabilitation Hospital at Lyndhurst Center, University of Toronto.

entry.title: Delivers Biomedical Research Equipment to Medical Science Faculty
entry.content: TDCC delivers to the Medical Sciences Faculty, University of Toronto, equipment developed for biomedical research.

entry.title: Signs Contract with Medical Science Faculty
entry.content: TDCC signs contract with Medical Sciences Faculty, University of Toronto, for development of biomedical research equipment.

entry.title: Participant in Proposal for Canadian Institute of Health Research
entry.content: TDCC becomes participant in proposal for Canadian Institute of Health Research (CIHR) Team for the Development, Testing and Knowledge Translation of Innovative Approaches to Optimize Gait and Balance of Older Adults, Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre, Toronto.

entry.title: Completes On-site Technical Support for Special Materials Automation System
entry.content: TDCC completes on-site technical support of high tech special materials manufacturing automation facility consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for profile generation in Asia.

entry.title: Completes On-site Technical Support for Special Materials Automation System
entry.content: TDCC completes commissioning of high tech special materials manufacturing automation facility consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for profile generation in Asia.

entry.title: Completes Technical Support of Special Materials Automation System
entry.content: TDCC completes technical support of high tech special materials manufacturing automation system consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for profile generation at Toronto, Canada.

entry.title: Feild Trails of Special Materials Manufacturing Automation System'
entry.content: TDCC commences commissioning and support of field trials of high tech special materials manufacturing automation system consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for profile generation at Toronto, Canada.

entry.title: Completion of of Manufacturing of Special Materials Automation System
entry.content: TDCC gets project from a Toronto based company to Design and Develop robotic and automation system consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for profile generation for export.

entry.title: Signs preproject Research and Development for Multi-Axis Simulator
entry.content: TDCC signs letter of intent/agreement with customer for pre-project study and development with a Toronto based company to Design and Develop robotic and automation system consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for profile generation for export.

entry.title: Delivery of Multi-Axis Motion Simulator
entry.content: TDCC delivers system for non-contact nano-particle manipulation/manufacturing system consisting of multi-axis motion simulator to Toronto based customer.

entry.title: Design and Development of Multi-Axis Motion Simulator
entry.content: TDCC commences design and development of non-contact nano-particle manipulation/manufacturing system consisting of multi-axis motion simulator for Toronto based customer.

entry.title: Commences Research for Canadian Customers
entry.content: TDCC commences in-house research and development activities with requirements in biotechnology and manufacturing automation of several customers in view in Canada and abroad.
